thread.title: Overtime with Matt Jones | Louisville will get in trouble
thread.title_full: Overtime with Matt Jones | Louisville will get in trouble

title: Overtime with Matt Jones | Louisville will get in trouble
text:
Overtime with Matt Jones | Louisville will get in trouble Updated: Fri 12:59 AM, Oct 09, 2015 / Headlines List / Article Breaking Cardinal Rules: Basketball and the Escort Queen, a tell-all book claiming that a former University of Louisville staffer hired escorts for players and recruits, was now the #1 selling book under basketball on Amazon. 
Kentucky Sports Radio's Matt Jones comments on the latest developments in the Louisville basketball scandal. 
"The craziest story that I can remember from the last few years got even crazier today when two players, one a former UofL recruit and one a former UofL player, both admitted that parts of the scandal involving strippers and prostitutes on the UofL campus were actually true. 
Now I don't know how all this is going to end but now we know one thing for sure, Louisville is going to get in trouble. There is no doubt at this point, because of whats been admitted so far, the NCAA will have no choice but to find probation and I would guess at some point very soon. You're going to hear that Louisville's going to sit out an NCAA Tournament. 
But the next question is the future of Rick Pitino. He did an interview today (Thursday) with Terry Meiners in Louisville that was really bizarre and ended up with him rambling about a lot of things and taking a subtle shot at the school president. 
Things are going to get weirder in Louisville and all we can say here in Lexington is thank goodness it's not happening to Kentucky. For once 'Little Brother' is not in an envious position."
